alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Island; City and Borough of Juneau; City and Borough of Wrangell; City of Hyder; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Klukwan; Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Petersburg Borough (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 12:00PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...Warming Temperatures Thursday through Sunday... There is a high potential for near record high temperatures soaring into the upper 70s and 80s throughout the Panhandle starting Thursday and continuing through Sunday. Friday will be the warmest day with a greater than 80 percent chance of communities seeing greater than 75 degrees. Warmest temperatures will occur across the far southern Panhandle and communities located further from coastal waters. There is a greater than 90 percent chance that far southern communities such as Ketchikan and Hyder will see temperatures greater than 80 degrees. There will be some variability in high temperatures due local afternoon seabreezes and any low stratus that forms during the overnight ours along coastal communities. Remember, as temperatures warm and fuels become dry, there will be an increased fire risk. To minimize impacts of the heat wave, locate fans for cooling; wear light- colored and loose fitting clothes; drink plenty of fluids, apply sun protection, and take breaks if you must be outdoors for extended periods; do not leave young children and pets unattended in closed vehicles; and plan to check on the elderly, and neighbors who could be more vulnerable.
